review: I bought the Stick because it's the only android based device that has the ability to run Kodi TV even though there isn't an official app for it on the Stick (but it is in the Amazon app store for other android devices?).  With a little bit of searching, it's easy to find out how to install Kodi which provides a huge range of content.We have exceptional wifi - 105mbs so buffering or delays are never a problem with this device.  Amazon Prime video is intuitive and you can actually view your watchlist on this device unlike the Amazon app on our Vizio TV.I hope that as the TV industry moves towards al la carte TV, Amazon will keep pace with the available streaming options.  I think we are only a year or two away from being able to buy only those 10-15 cable channels you actually watch for a very reasonable price and then streaming them via a device like this.  No more paying for 200 channels you never watch because of devices like this.I'm curious at this point if the voice activated remote works well on the regular Fire TV.  While the one that comes with this is simple to use, it does take some time if you have to fill in a search box using the old point and click on screen keyboard.  In fairness, you can avoid all that with the TV app on your Kindle or smartphone and it works quite well but a voice controlled remote that actually understood speech would be so convenient.
